meanings.definition: Having a strong desire or interest in something.
meanings.sent1: The avid reader couldn't put down the book.
meanings.sent2: She is an avid fan of the local baseball team.
meanings.sent3: The avid gardener talked to her plants every day.
meanings.sent4: His avid pursuit of knowledge led him to read every book in the library.
meanings.sent5: The avid birdwatcher could identify any species by its call.

meanings.sent1: The avid student eagerly raised his hand to answer the question.
meanings.sent2: She was avid for adventure and always seeking new experiences.
meanings.sent3: The avid traveler packed his bags as soon as he heard about the trip.
meanings.sent4: His avid hunger for success drove him to work hard every day.
meanings.sent5: The avid collector searched tirelessly for rare stamps to add to his collection.
